result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:22 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jose M Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in custody at MSDF.
Clerk advises no video appearance was arranged for today.
Court will reschedule this matter and have the defendant appear by video for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Jose M Cruz in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jose M Cruz.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Gutierrez request an adjournment for the defendant to have his revocation hearing before the preliminary hearing.  State is ready to proceed with the officer and objects.  Court denies the adjournment.  Atty. Thompson states the offer will be revoked if the case proceeds to preliminary hearing.  Court goes over the withdrawal of the offer with the defendant.  City of Muskego Police Officer Zachary Patterson sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Thompson.  Cross examination by Atty. Gutierrez.  Redirect. State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Thompson moves for bind over.  Atty. Gutierrez makes closing statements.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Letter dated 08/30/22 requesting adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
08/31/22 **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 08/31/22 Request Denied. Defendant already produced.

Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 10:15 am.

**Notice re-printed with OTP language in notice text.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 10:15 am.

08:37 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Jose M Cruz did not appear (currently in custody at MSDF).   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gutierrez states the defendant is currently in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility and requests an adjournment so the defendant may be produced.  Court adjourns matter for a preliminary hearing and time limits previously waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:15 am.

no dates on bond were changed when received in C/T

ADDRESS INFO for Jose M Cruz
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)

08:36 AM Defendant Jose M Cruz in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of second amended complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Gutierrez is asking for an adjournment of the preliminary hearing to after the defendant's revocation hearing on 07/28/2022.  No objection by the State.  The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing to after that date.  Time limits were previously waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Second Amended Complaint
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

DA requests to adjourn prelim due to their witness not being available. Sent to CC Costello for review: court's response on 6/09: Granted. Time limits previously waive, no Marsy's Law issues, Defense doesn't object.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with witness A/any place of employment for witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to forfeit his firearms in his residence within 24 hours to a Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to discuss the case with Luis Curet.

01:04 PM Defendant Jose M Cruz in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Luis Daniel Gutierrez moves to dismiss count #2.  Court pulls through an amended criminal complaint.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Atty. Luis Daniel Gutierrez withdraws his motion to dismiss count #2.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

03:11 PM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Jose M Cruz did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was notified by the Sheriff's Department the defendant has refused to come to Court today.  The Court will set this matter over for an initial appearance to tomorrow.  The Court will authorize the use of force and order the defendant be produced tomorrow.  Court directs the Sheriff's department to physically put defendant into the restraint chair or sled if he does not voluntarily appear.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
